content.description: In pea plants, flower color and the length of the flower’s pollen grains are genetically determined. Researchers studying pea plants crossed homozygous dominant pea plants with homozygous recessive pea plants. The <math alttext="F 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> plants were then crossed, and the number of offspring with each phenotype was recorded. The researchers’ observed data, however, differed from the expected data. The researchers did a chi-square analysis and calculated the chi-square value to be <math alttext="5.5" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>5.5</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>.
content.question: Based on their calculation, the researchers would most likely conclude which of the following?

choices.label: The genes that determine these two traits are likely on the same chromosome.
The differences between observed data and expected data are due to chance.
The genes mutated since the researchers began the experiment and now have a different inheritance pattern.
The allele frequencies of the offspring have changed, suggesting the population is evolving.

content.answer: The differences between observed data and expected data are due to chance.
